lines.content: King Bob is a software which optimizes the use of the Command Line Interface (CLI) to manage tasks. :computer:
1. Ensure you have Java `11` installed into your Computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the *homefolder* for your Duke
4. If you are using Windows, open a command prompt terminal and navigate to the folder where your `iP.jar` is stored.
5. For Mac or Linux users, execute step 4 with your respective system terminals.
If the program is running correctly, you should be able to see the following:
What can I do for you?
7. Refer to the [Features](#features) below for the details of commands you can execute.
Adds a todo task to the list. todo tasks only contains a description of the task.
- Adds a todo task at the specified `TASK_DESCRIPTION`.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task(s) in the list.
Adds an event task to the list. An event task requires a task description and the details of the event, such as and
- Adds an event task at the specified `TASK_DESCRIPTION`.
- Stores the associated time or location at the specified `EVENT_DETAILS`.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 task(s) in the list.
Adds a deadline task to the list. A deadline task requires a task description and the due date or time it should be
- Adds a deadline task at the specified `TASK_DESCRIPTION`.
- Stores due date or time at the specified `DEADLINE`.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 task(s) in the list.
Shows all tasks stored in King Bob.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Deletes a task in the list.
- Deletes the task at the specified `INDEX`.
- This index refers to the index number shown in the task list.
- The index number **must be a positive integer** 1, 2, 3...
Now you have 2 task(s) in the list.
Marks a task in the list as done.
- Marks the task at the specified `INDEX`.
- This index refers to the index number shown in the task list.
- The index number **must be a positive integer** 1, 2, 3...
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Unmarks a task in the list as not done.
- Unmarks the task at the specified `INDEX`.
- This index refers to the index number shown in the task list.
- The index number **must be a positive integer** 1, 2, 3...
OK, I've marked this task as not done:
Find any task(s) that contains the specified keywords.
- The search is not case-sensitive eg. `kevin` will match `Kevin`.
- The order of the Keywords matter eg. `Birthday Party` will not match `Party Birthday`.
- Partial words will also be matched eg. `kev` will match `kevin`
- Only the task description is searched
All `find kev`,`find kevin` and `find Kevin` return the same tasks 1 and 2
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
King Bob automatically saves your task list in your local hard disk after exiting the program. There is no need to save
The task list is saved as a text file located at `[JAR FILE LOCATION]/data/dukesaved.txt`. Users are welcome to edit and
update the data directly by editing this text file.
> Please make sure changes made to the data file are in the valid format!
**Q**: How do I transfer data to another Computer?
**A**: Install the app in the other computer and overwrite the empty data file it creates with the file that contains the data of your previous list home folder.
**Q**: I have forgotten to specify a `TASK_DESCRIPTION`! Will it add an empty task?
**A**: If the `TASK_DESCRIPTION` is empty not to worry, King Bob will prompt you for one and you can retype your command.
| Add : Event    | `event TASK_DESCRIPTION /at EVENT_DETAILS` | `event book club /at 9pm`             |
| Add : Deadline | `deadline TASK_DESCRIPTION /by DEADLINE`   | `deadline CS2113 iP /by 30 Sept 2359` |
* Duke is program that allows users to manage a tasklist on the command line interface.
* It stores 3 types of tasks : todo, event and deadline
* Constructor to initiate Storage, Parse and UI objects.
* Prints error message when task description is empty in user input.
* Prints error message when an invalid command is entered.
+ ":( OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(\n"
* Prints error message when an invalid task number is entered.
+ ":( OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but this is not in the list\n"
* Parser class parses and processes the user inputs and implements the relevant objects.
* This function reads in and processes the user's input.
* @return User chooses to exit the program
* Throws an unknown command error if user input is not in a valid format.
* Storage class transfers user list data into a text file and reads from the saved text file upon opening the program.
private static File file = new File(FILEPATH);
* Load list data from existing text file.
* @throws IOException IO error when creating or reading from file.
public void loadData(TaskManager taskManager) throws IOException {
* Creates a new file if there is no existing one.
* @throws IOException IO error when creating the file
* Prints message that program is unable to find file and will proceed to create a new one.
* Read list data from existing text file.
public static void readFromFile(String data) throws FileNotFoundException {
* Writes updated list data to text file.
* @throws IOException IO error when writing to file
public static void writeToFile() throws IOException {
* Adds todo task from file to running program list.
* @param mark        indicates if task is done or not done
public static void addFileToDo(String mark, String description) {
* Adds event task from file to running program list.
* @param mark        indicates if task is done or not done
public static void addFileEvent(String mark, String description, String at) {
* Adds deadline task from file to running program list.
* @param mark        indicates if task is done or not done
public static void addFileDeadline(String mark, String description, String by) {
* Insert tasks into the next array element of list.
* Deadline class constructor initialises the task description and due date.
* Converts Deadline task to a String output.
* @return deadline task in the format of tasktype, marked or unmarked, task description and due date.
* Converts Deadline task to a format that can be stored in a text file.
* @return deadline task variables separated by a pipe symbol (|).
* Event class constructor initialises the task description and event details.
* @param at          event details for example: location, time or date of the event
* Converts Event task to a String output.
* @return event task in the format of tasktype, marked or unmarked, task description and event details.
* Converts Event task to a format that can be stored in a text file.
* @return event task variables separated by a pipe symbol (|).
* TaskManager handles all task operations ie. adding, deleting, finding etc.
public static final String TASK_ADDED = "Got it. I've added this task:\n";
public static ArrayList<Tasks> taskList = new ArrayList<>();
* Checks if a task description has been specified in user input.
public static String checkCommandLength(String description) throws ArguementNotFoundException {
* Checks if task number specified is within the list's range.
* @throws WrongArgumentException invalid task number outside of list
public static int checkTaskNumber(int input) throws WrongArgumentException {
* Obtains specified task number from user input.
private static int getTaskNumber(String command, String action) {
* Add a task into the list and prints an indication it has been added successfully
+ "Now you have " + numOfTasks + "task(s) in the list.\n"
* Adds a todo type task to the list
* Adds an event type task to the list
* Adds a deadline type task to the list
* mark a task in the list.
* @param input position of item to mark in the list.
* unmark a task in the list.
* @param input user input position of item to unmark in the list.
* Deletes a specific task in the list.
* @param input user input with position of item to delete in the list.
+ "Now you have " + numOfTasks + " task(s) in the list.\n"
* Finds a specific task in the list.
* @param input user input with keywords to look for in list.
* Prints all tasks found in list after searching for keyword.
* @param matchingTasks array with matching tasks in chronological order.
+ "Here are the matching task(s) in your list:"
+ "Here are the task(s) in your list:"
* Get status of list item if it is done or undone
* Gets task description of a list item
* Mark an item as not done
+ "OK, I've marked this task as not done:\n"
+ "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n"
* Marks a loaded item from file as done
* Unarks a loaded item from file as not done
* @return Respective task type String to store into text file
* Todo class constructor initialises the description of the todo task.
* Converts Todo task to a String output.
* @return todo task in the format of tasktype, marked or unmarked and task description.
* Converts Todo task to a format that can be stored in a text file.
* @return Todo task variables separated by a pipe symbol (|).
* UI class manages the printing of various messages
* Prints welcome message when program is first opened.
+ " What can I do for you?\n"
* Prints exit message when program is closing.
* Prints error message when text file cannot load.
